api/Chaos.Common.Abstractions.IInterlock.title: Interface IInterlockedObject<T> | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Common.Abstractions.IInterlock.keywords: Interface IInterlockedObject<T> Defines the pattern for a wrapper around a reference type to perform thread safe operations on it Namespace : Chaos.Common.Abstractions Assembly : Chaos.Common.Abstractions.dll Syntax public interface IInterlockedObject<T> where T : class Type Parameters Name Description T Methods Name Description Get() Gets the underlying object. Retreival is atomic. Set(T) Sets the underlying object. Assignment is atomic. SetIfNull(T) Sets the underlying object if the current value is null. Operation is atomic. TryRemove(T) Sets the underlying object to null if the caller provides the current value. Operation is atomic. TryReplace(T, T) Sets the underlying object to the new value if the old value is provided. Operation is atomic.

api/Chaos.Common.Definitions.ServerMessa.title: Enum ServerMessageType | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Common.Definitions.ServerMessa.keywords: Enum ServerMessageType A byte switch as used for ServerOpCode.ServerMessage Namespace : Chaos.Common.Definitions Assembly : Chaos.Common.dll Syntax public enum ServerMessageType : byte Fields Name Description ActiveMessage Texts appears in the action bar and Shift+F AdminMessage Text is only in the action bar, and will not show up in Shift+F. In official this was used for admin world messages ClosePopup Closes opened pop-up windows. ScrollWindow , NonScrollWindow , WoodenBoard GroupChat Text appears in a puke-green color. In official this was used for group chat GuildChat Text appears in an olive-green color. In official this was used for guild chat NonScrollWindow Pops open a window with no scroll bar. In official this was used for perish lore OrangeBar1 Text is only in the action bar, and will not show up in Shift+F OrangeBar2 Text is only in the action bar, and will not show up in Shift+F OrangeBar3 Text is only in the action bar, and will not show up in Shift+F OrangeBar5 Text is only in the action bar, and will not show up in Shift+F PersistentMessage Text appears white, and persists indefinitely until cleared in the top right corner ScrollWindow Pops open a window with a scroll bar. In official this was used for Sense UserOptions UserOption s are sent via this text channel Whisper Text appears blue, and appears in the top left WoodenBoard Pops open a window with a wooden boarder. In official this was used for signposts and wooden boards

api/Chaos.Data.ShardingOptions.ExitLocat.title: Property ExitLocation | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Data.ShardingOptions.ExitLocat.keywords: Property ExitLocation | Improve this Doc View Source ExitLocation The instanceId to teleport players to if they log on and the instance no longer exists Declaration public Location ExitLocation { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Location Remarks Imagine a scenario where a players disconnects. They should be able to log back into the instance they were already in. Now imagine a scenario where a player logs off, then logs back on 5 hours later. The instance will likely no longer exist. We can't simply create a new instance for them, this would be abusable (bosses would respawn, events would reset, etc) This instanceid is the place to put people who are in this scenario, generally speaking it should be the map you enter this instance from

api/Chaos.Extensions.Geometry.PointExten.title: Method GenerateCardinalPoints | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Extensions.Geometry.PointExten.keywords: Method GenerateCardinalPoints | Improve this Doc View Source GenerateCardinalPoints(IPoint, Int32) Lazily generates an enumeration of points in a line from the user, with an option for distance and direction. Direction.All is optional. Direction.Invalid direction returns empty list. Declaration public static IEnumerable<Point> GenerateCardinalPoints(this IPoint start, int radius = 1) Parameters Type Name Description IPoint start System.Int32 radius The max distance to generate points Returns Type Description IEnumerable < Point > Remarks Assumes is equivalent to the cardinal direction "North", this method will generate points in all 4 cardinal directions. Points will be generated 1 radius at a time, clock-wise. Examples //generates points in a counter clockwise spiral around the start //will generate the 4 points immediately around the start var points = new Point(0, 0).GenerateCardinalPoints(1);

api/Chaos.Extensions.Geometry.PointExten.title: Method GenerateIntercardinalPoints | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Extensions.Geometry.PointExten.keywords: Method GenerateIntercardinalPoints | Improve this Doc View Source GenerateIntercardinalPoints(IPoint, Direction, Int32) Lazily generates an enumeration of diagonal points in relevance to the user, with an optional distance and direction. Direction.All is optional. Direction.Invalid direction returns an empty enumeration Declaration public static IEnumerable<Point> GenerateIntercardinalPoints(this IPoint start, Direction direction = null, int radius = 1) Parameters Type Name Description IPoint start Direction direction The general direction to generate points for. See remarks. System.Int32 radius The range in which to generate points Returns Type Description IEnumerable < Point > Remarks Assuming is equivalent to the cardinal direction "North", this method will generate points in the inter-cardinal directions "North-East", "South-East", "South-West", and "North-West". Points will be generated 1 radius at a time, clock-wise. Optionally, you can choose a cardinal to generate points for the 2 inter-cardinal directions that share the given cardinal direction. Examples //this call will generate points in the inter-cardinal directions "North-West" and "North-East" //4 points will be generated, 2 in each inter-cardinal direction //the points will be diagonal to the original point var points = new Point(0, 0).GenerateInterCardinalPoints(Direction.Up, 2); //this call will generate points in the inter-cardinal directions "South-West" and "South-East" //10 points will be generated, 5 in each inter-cardinal direction //the points will be diagonal to the original point var points = new Point(0, 0).GenerateInterCardinalPoints(Direction.Down, 5); //this call will generate points in all inter-cardinal directions //12 points will be generated, 3 in each inter-cardinal direction //the points will be diagonal to the original point var points = new Point(0, 0).GenerateInterCardinalPoints(Direction.All, 3);

api/Chaos.Networking.Abstractions.html.title: Namespace Chaos.Networking.Abstractions | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Networking.Abstractions.html.keywords: Namespace Chaos.Networking.Abstractions Classes ServerBase<T> SocketClientBase Interfaces IClientRegistry<T> Defines the pattern for a service that clients register to so that they are more easily discovered ILobbyServer<TClient> Defines a pattern for server that presents a list of available login servers to connect to ILoginServer<TClient> Defines a pattern for a server that facilitates character creation, presentation of the EULA, and the ability to log into a character or change a character's password INotice Represents the notice shown when logging into a server IRedirect Represents an object used to instruct and track a client during a redirect operation IRedirectInfo Defines a configuration object to set up redirects that will be added to the login notice IRedirectManager An object used to manage redirects IServer<TClient> Defines the bare minimum for a server IServerInfo Defines a configuration object that is used to describe a login server IServerTable Defines the requirements for a server table. The server table is used to display available servers to connect to from the lobby server. ISocketClient Defines a pattern for an object that has the ability to send and receive packets over a socket connection IWorldServer<TClient> Defines a pattern for a server that facilites all aspects of actual gameplay Delegates ServerBase<T>.ClientHandler

api/Chaos.Networking.Abstractions.ILogin.keywords: Interface ILoginServer<TClient> Defines a pattern for a server that facilitates character creation, presentation of the EULA, and the ability to log into a character or change a character's password Inherited Members IServer<TClient>.HandlePacketAsync(TClient, ClientPacket) IServer<TClient>.OnHeartBeatAsync(TClient, ClientPacket) IServer<TClient>.OnSequenceChangeAsync(TClient, ClientPacket) IServer<TClient>.OnSynchronizeTicksAsync(TClient, ClientPacket) Namespace : Chaos.Networking.Abstractions Assembly : Chaos.Networking.Abstractions.dll Syntax public interface ILoginServer<in TClient> : IServer<TClient> where TClient : ISocketClient Type Parameters Name Description TClient Methods Name Description OnClientRedirected(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client is redirected to this login server. This is the second step in the process and will contain appearance details OnCreateCharRequest(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client requests to create a new character. This is the first step in the process and will only contain a name and password OnHomepageRequest(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client requests the url of the homepage OnLogin(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client provides credentials to log into the world OnMetafileRequest(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client requests either a metafile hash, or a full copy of the metafiles OnNoticeRequest(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client requests EULA details OnPasswordChange(TClient, in ClientPacket) Occurs when a client requests to change a character's password

api/Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitio.title: Enum ClientOpCode | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitio.keywords: Enum ClientOpCode OpCodes used when receiving packets from a client Namespace : Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitions Assembly : Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.dll Syntax public enum ClientOpCode : byte Remarks In networking, an opcode is used to identify the type of packet that is being sent. The opcode is generally part of a header near the beginning of the data stream Fields Name Description BeginChant OpCode used when a client begins casting a spell with cast lines Hex value: 0x4D BoardRequest OpCode used when a client accesses a board or mail Hex value: 0x3B Chant OpCode used when a client uses an ability that has chant lines Hex value: 0x4E Click OpCode used when a client clicks on an object Hex value: 0x43 ClientRedirected OpCode used when a client is redirected to this server Hex value: 0x10 ClientWalk OpCode used when a client walks in a direction Hex value: 0x06 ConnectionInfoRequest OpCode used when a client requests the encryption details, and a checksum of the details of available login servers Hex value: 0x00 CreateCharFinalize OpCode used when a client requests to create a new character. This is the second step in the process and will contain appearance details Hex value: 0x04 CreateCharRequest Opcode used when a client requests to create a new character. This is the first step in the process and will only contain a name and password Hex value: 0x02 DialogResponse OpCode used when a client responds to a dialog Hex value: 0x3A DisplayObjectRequest OpCode used when a client requests the server to display an object Hex value: 0x0C Emote OpCode used when a client uses an emote Hex value: 0x1B Exchange OpCode used when a client interacts with an exchange window Hex value: 0x4A ExitRequest OpCode used when a client tries to log out Hex value: 0x0B GoldDrop OpCode used when a client drops gold on the ground Hex value: 0x24 GoldDroppedOnCreature OpCode used when a client drops gold on a creature Hex value: 0x3A GroupRequest OpCode used when a client invites another player to a group, responds to a group invite, or creates or destroys a group box Hex value: 0x2E HeartBeat OpCode used when a client sends a heartbeat(keep-alive) ping Hex value: 0x45 HomepageRequest OpCode used when a client requests the url of the homepage Hex value: 0x68 Ignore OpCode used when a client ignores or un-ignores another player, or requests a list of ignored players Hex value: 0x0D ItemDrop OpCode used when a client drops an item on the ground Hex value: 0x08 ItemDroppedOnCreature OpCode used when a client drops an item on a creature Hex value: 0x29 Login OpCode used when a client provides credentials to log into the world Hex value: 0x03 MetafileRequest OpCode used when a client requests metadata details or data Hex value: 0x7B NoticeRequest OpCode used when a client requests EULA details Hex value: 0x4B PasswordChange OpCode used when a client requests to change a character's password Hex value: 0x26 Pickup OpCode used when a client picks up an item from the ground Hex value: 0x07 Profile OpCode used when a client responds to a request for profile data (portrait, text) Hex value: 0x4F PublicMessage OpCode used when a client sends a publicly visible message Hex value: 0x0E PursuitRequest OpCode used when a client responds to a merchant menu Hex value: 0x39 RaiseStat OpCode used when a client requests to raise a stat Hex value: 0x47 RequestMapData OpCode used when a client requests tile data for the current map Hex value: 0x05 RequestProfile OpCode used when a client requests the profile of another player Hex value: 0x2D RequestRefresh OpCode used when a client refreshes their viewport Hex value: 0x38 SequenceChange OpCode used when a client requests to change the packet sequence number Hex value: 0x62 ServerTableRequest OpCode used when a client requests the details of available login servers Hex value: 0x57 SetNotepad OpCode used when a client sets persistent text on an object Hex value: 0x23 SocialStatus OpCode used when a client changes their social status Hex value: 0x79 SpaceBar OpCode used when a client presses their spacebar Hex value: 0x13 SwapSlot OpCode used when a client swaps two panel objects Hex value: 0x30 SynchronizeTicks OpCode used when a client sends it's Environment.Ticks value Hex value: 0x75 ToggleGroup OpCode used when a client toggles their group availability Hex value: 0x2F Turn OpCode used when a client changes their character's direction Hex value: 0x11 Unequip OpCode used when a client unequips an item Hex value: 0x44 UseItem OpCode used when a client uses an item Hex value: 0x1A UserOptionToggle OpCode used when a client toggles a user option Hex value: 0x1B UseSkill OpCode used when a client uses a skill Hex value: 0x3E UseSpell OpCode used when a client uses a spell Hex value: 0x0F Whisper OpCode used when a client sends a private message to the server Hex value: 0x19 WorldListRequest OpCode used when a client requests a list of all online players Hex value: 0x18 WorldMapClick OpCode used when a client clicks on a world map node Hex value: 0x3F

api/Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitio.keywords: Namespace Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitions Enums ClientOpCode OpCodes used when receiving packets from a client ServerOpCode OpCodes used when sending packets to a client

api/Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitio.title: Enum ServerOpCode | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitio.keywords: Enum ServerOpCode OpCodes used when sending packets to a client Namespace : Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.Definitions Assembly : Chaos.Packets.Abstractions.dll Syntax public enum ServerOpCode : byte Remarks In networking, an opcode is used to identify the type of packet that is being sent. The opcode is generally part of a header near the beginning of the data stream Fields Name Description AcceptConnection OpCode sent to a client to confirm their initial connection Hex value: 0x7E AddItemToPane OpCode used to add an item to the client's inventory Hex value: 0x0F AddSkillToPane OpCode used to add a skill to a client's skillbook Hex value: 0x2C AddSpellToPane OpCode used to add a spell to the client's spellbook Hex value: 0x17 Animation OpCode used to play an animation on a point or object Hex value: 0x29 Attributes OpCode used to send a client it's attributes Hex value: 0x08 BodyAnimation OpCode used to animate a creature's body Hex value: 0x1A BulletinBoard OpCode used to display a board to a client Hex value: 0x31 CancelCasting OpCode used to tell a client to cancel a spellcast Hex value: 0x48 ConfirmClientWalk OpCode used to respond to a client's request to walk Hex value: 0x0B ConfirmExit OpCode used to send a client confirmation of a request to exit to the login server Hex value: 0x4C ConnectionInfo OpCode used to send the encryption details and checksum of the details of available login servers Hex value: 0x00 Cooldown OpCode used to send a skill or spell cooldown to a client Hex value: 0x3F CreatureTurn OpCode used to send a client another creature's turn Hex value: 0x11 CreatureWalk OpCode used to send a client another creature's walk Hex value: 0x0C Dialog OpCode used to display a dialog to a client Hex value: 0x30 DisplayAisling OpCode used to display an aisling to a client Hex value: 0x33 DisplayVisibleObject OpCode used to send a client all non-aisling objects in it's viewport Hex value: 0x07 Door OpCode used to give details of nearby doors to a client Hex value: 0x32 Effect OpCode used to display an effect on the bar on the right hand side of the viewport Hex value: 0x3A Equipment OpCode used to send a client a change in an equipment slot Hex value: 0x37 Exchange OpCode used to send data displayed int an exchange window to a client Hex value: 0x42 ForceClientPacket OpCode used to force a client to send back a specified packet Hex value: 0x4B GroupRequest OpCode used to send a client a group request Hex value: 0x63 HealthBar OpCode used to display a creature's health bar Hex value: 0x13 HeartBeatResponse OpCode used to respond to a client's heartbeat Hex value: 0x3B LightLevel OpCode used to change the light level of the map Hex value: 0x20 Location OpCode used to send a client it's location Hex value: 0x04 LoginControls OpCode used to send a client data for the lobby Hex value: 0x66 LoginMessage OpCode used to send a message to a client on the login server Hex value: 0x02 LoginNotification OpCode used to send a client the EULA / login notice Hex value: 0x60 MapChangeComplete OpCode used to signal to the client that a map change operation has completed Hex value: 0x1F MapChangePending OpCode used to signal a client that it is changing maps Hex value: 0x67 MapData OpCode used to send a client tile data for a map Hex value: 0x3C MapInfo OpCode used to send map details to a client Hex value: 0x15 MapLoadComplete OpCode used to signal a client that it has finished sending map data Hex value: 0x58 Menu OpCode used to display a merchant menu to a client Hex value: 0x2F Metafile OpCode used to send metafile data to a client Hex value: 0x6F Notepad OpCode used to associate text with an object Hex value: 0x1B Profile OpCode used to display an aisling's profile to a client Hex value: 0x34 ProfileRequest OpCode used to request profile details from a client Hex value: 0x49 PublicMessage OpCode used to send a client a public message Hex value: 0x0D Redirect OpCode used to redirect a client to another server Hex value: 0x03 RefreshResponse OpCode used to respond to a client's request to refresh the viewport Hex value: 0x22 RemoveItemFromPane OpCode used to remove an item from the client's inventory Hex value: 0x10 RemoveObject OpCode used to remove an object from the client's viewport Hex value: 0x0E RemoveSkillFromPane OpCode used to remove a skill from a client's skillbook Hex value: 0x2D RemoveSpellFromPane OpCode used to remove a spell from the client's spellbook Hex value: 0x18 SelfProfile OpCode used to send a client it's own profile Hex value: 0x39 ServerMessage OpCode used to send a client a non-public message Hex value: 0x0A ServerTable OpCode used to send a client a list of available servers Hex value: 0x56 Sound OpCode used to tell the client to play a sound Hex value: 0x19 SynchronizeTicks OpCode used to synchronize the server's ticks with a client's Hex value: 0x68 Unequip OpCode used to send a client a removal from an equipment slot Hex value: 0x38 UserId OpCode used to send a client it's id Hex value: 0x05 WorldList OpCode used to display the world list to a client Hex value: 0x36 WorldMap OpCode used to transition a client to the world map Hex value: 0x2E

api/Chaos.Schemas.Data.ShardingOptionsSc.title: Property ExitLocation | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Schemas.Data.ShardingOptionsSc.keywords: Property ExitLocation | Improve this Doc View Source ExitLocation The instanceId to teleport players to if they log on and the instance no longer exists Declaration [JsonRequired] public Location ExitLocation { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Location Remarks Imagine a scenario where a players disconnects. They should be able to log back into the instance they were already in. Now imagine a scenario where a player logs off, then logs back on 5 hours later. The instance will likely no longer exist. We can't simply create a new instance for them, this would be abusable (bosses would respawn, events would reset, etc) This instanceid is the place to put people who are in this scenario, generally speaking it should be the map you enter this instance from

api/Chaos.Scripting.ScriptFactory-2.html.keywords: Class ScriptFactory<TScript, TScripted> A factory object that generates IScript s Inheritance System.Object ScriptFactory<TScript, TScripted> Implements IScriptFactory <TScript, TScripted> Inherited Members System.Object.Equals(System.Object) System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.GetHashCode() System.Object.GetType() System.Object.MemberwiseClone() System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.ToString() Namespace : Chaos.Scripting Assembly : Chaos.Scripting.dll Syntax public sealed class ScriptFactory<TScript, TScripted> : IScriptFactory<TScript, TScripted> where TScript : IScript where TScripted : IScripted Type Parameters Name Description TScript A type of script TScripted A type of scripted object Remarks This object requires that any given IScript type has an implemented ICompositeScript<TScript> type. This script factory will utilize that composite script to compose multiple scripts into one. The script returned by this factory will always be the ICompositeScript<TScript> implementation, and it will contain all of scripts generated from the keys that are supplied. api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.title: Property AislingAssailIntervalMs | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.keywords: Property AislingAssailIntervalMs | Improve this Doc View Source AislingAssailIntervalMs All creatures have an AssailInterval. AssailInterval is essentially the cooldown in milliseconds for skills marked as assails. This value ismodified by the AtkSpeedPct attribute and can be modified to be 3x faster or slower than the base value. This property sets the base interval for all aislings. A good starting value is 1500 Declaration int AislingAssailIntervalMs { get; } Property Value Type Description System.Int32

api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.title: Property DropRange | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.keywords: Property DropRange | Improve this Doc View Source DropRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they can drop items or gold on the ground. A value of -1 would effectively disable dropping items A value of 0 would only allow players to drop items directly beneath them A value of 12 would allow players to drop items anywhere in their viewport Declaration int DropRange { get; } Property Value Type Description System.Int32

api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.title: Property F1MerchantTemplateKey | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.keywords: Property F1MerchantTemplateKey | Improve this Doc View Source F1MerchantTemplateKey This is the template key of the merchant to display when a player presses F1. This is generally some kind of help npc Declaration string F1MerchantTemplateKey { get; } Property Value Type Description System.String

api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.title: Interface IWorldOptions | Chaos Server Docs
api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.keywords: Interface IWorldOptions Namespace : Chaos.Services.Servers.Options Assembly : Chaos.dll Syntax public interface IWorldOptions Properties Name Description AislingAssailIntervalMs All creatures have an AssailInterval. AssailInterval is essentially the cooldown in milliseconds for skills marked as assails. This value ismodified by the AtkSpeedPct attribute and can be modified to be 3x faster or slower than the base value. This property sets the base interval for all aislings. A good starting value is 1500 DropRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they can drop items or gold on the ground. A value of -1 would effectively disable dropping items A value of 0 would only allow players to drop items directly beneath them A value of 12 would allow players to drop items anywhere in their viewport F1MerchantTemplateKey This is the template key of the merchant to display when a player presses F1. This is generally some kind of help npc MaxActionsPerSecond It would be bad to allow players to perform an infinite number of actions per second. Anything without a cooldown could become a huge burden on the server. This value is used to control the maximum number of actions a player can take in a second. An action is defined as using any spell, skill, or item. This includes equipping items. A good range of values for this would be 4 - 10 If desired, this value can be set to 3 to emulate the original game MaxChantTimeBurdenMs When players cast spells, each spell line takes approximately 1000ms to chant. The amount of time a spell will take to cast can be predicted to be 1000ms * (NumSpellLines). Due to latency and jitter, players will often cast spells for slightly more or less than the expected amount of time. With big latency spikes, the observed amount of time could be far off than the expected value. To be able to tolerate this while also prohibiting "speed casting", the server will allow spell casts that occur too quickly and add up a time burden. Each time a player casts a spell that completes faster than expected, the difference in time will be added to the time burden. This burden will accumulate with every consecutive spell that occurs too quickly, and be subtracted from if a spell completes too slowly. The time burden will also decrease while not casting spells. If the time burden exceeds MaxChantTimeBurdenMs, the spell cast will be ignored. A good range of values for this setting would be 500 - 1500, with lower values being more strict. MaxGoldHeld This is the maximum amount of gold a player can hold in their inventory. MaxGroupSize The maximum number of players that can be in a group together. If a group reaches this size, invites and invite accepts will fail. MaximumAislingAc This is the maximum amount of AC a player can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, higher AC = more damage taken. MaximumMonsterAc This is the maximum amount of AC a monster can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, higher AC = more damage taken. MaxLevel This is the level cap for players. Level formulas can be changed, but with the default level formula, if you reach this level you will stop gaining experience. MaxSkillsPerSecond The maximum number of skills a player can use in a second MaxSpellsPerSecond The maximum number of spells a player can use in a second MinimumAislingAc This is the minimum amount of AC a player can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, lower AC = less damage taken. With the default damage formula, AC is a percentile, so -100 AC would make you invulnerable. MinimumMonsterAc This is the minimum amount of AC a monster can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, lower AC = less damage taken. With the default damage formula, AC is a percentile, so -100 AC would make you invulnerable. PickupRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they pick up items or money from the ground. A value of -1 would effectively disable picking up items A value of 0 would only allow players to pick up items from directly beneath them A value of 12 would allow players to pick up items from anywhere in their viewport ProhibitF5Walk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing refreshing(F5) to walk faster. ProhibitItemSwitchWalk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing item switching to walk faster. ProhibitSpeedWalk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing more nefarious methods to walk faster. RefreshIntervalMs This is the quickest interval in milliseconds that players will be allowed to refresh their client. This will not include refreshes utilized by the server, such as for refreshing a player's position if they walk into a wall. A good value here would be 1000 SaveIntervalMins This is the amount of time in minutes between global character saves. This is on top of players automatically saving when they log out. Do not set this value too low or it will become a burden on the server. A good range of values would be anywhere from 0.5 - 10 TradeRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they can initiate a trade with another player A value of -1 would effectively disable trading A value of 0 would only allow players to only trade with players on the same tile, which is generally impossible A value of 12 would allow players to trade with anyone in their viewport UpdatesPerSecond This is the number of times per second that the server will update the game state. .NET isn't great for this kind of workload due garbage collection and JIT recompilation/OSR. I suggest a hard cap of 60 with a good default value of 30 If desired you can set this to 3 to emulate the original game

Each time a player casts a spell that completes faster than expected, the difference in time will be added to the time burden. This burden will accumulate with every consecutive spell that occurs too quickly, and be subtracted from if a spell completes too slowly. The time burden will also decrease while not casting spells. If the time burden exceeds MaxChantTimeBurdenMs, the spell cast will be ignored. A good range of values for this setting would be 500 - 1500, with lower values being more strict. Declaration int MaxChantTimeBurdenMs { get; } Property Value Type Description System.Int32

api/Chaos.Services.Servers.Options.IWorl.keywords: Property UpdatesPerSecond | Improve this Doc View Source UpdatesPerSecond This is the number of times per second that the server will update the game state. .NET isn't great for this kind of workload due garbage collection and JIT recompilation/OSR. articles/Formulae.html.title: Formulae | Chaos Server Docs
articles/Formulae.html.keywords: Formulae Formulae are an underlying component to scripts. They are used to calculate the results of actions. For example, the final damage calculation of an attack, taking into account AC and elemental modifiers. Formulae are found under Chaos.Formulae . There are several default formulae, but developers are free to write their own. Note Formulae are not scripts. They are not tied to any specific entity. They are simply a reusable way to calculate something Formulae are often used in functional scripts, and their implementations are swappable DamageFormulae Damage formulas are used to calculate the final damage of abilities. If some damage calculation must occur on a majority of damage calculations, creating or modifying a damage formula is the way to do it. Note The default damage formula is used by the default applyDamage functional script ExperienceFormulae Experience formulas are used to calculate the amount of experience a monster gives. This calculation could include some variables like monster level, player level, group size, and group level. Note The default experience formula is used by the default experience distribution functional script LevelRangeFormulae LevelRange formulas are used to calculate the upper and lower bounds of a level range. This is used to determine color on the world list, as well as playing a part in experience distribution. Note The default level range formula is used by the default experience formula LevelUpformulae LevelUp formulas are used to calculate several aspects of leveling up, such as the next level's TNI, attribute increases, max weight calculation, and more. Note The default level up formula is used by the default level up functional script RegenFormulae Regen formulas are used to calculate the amount of health and mana a creature naturally regenerates. A creature could be a player, monster, merchant, etc... Note The default regen formula is used by the default natural regeneration functional script

articles/FunctionalScripts.html.title: FunctionalScripts | Chaos Server Docs
articles/FunctionalScripts.html.keywords: FunctionalScripts Functional scripts are a special kind of script that is handled slightly differently than other scripts. They are used to handle specific kinds of interactions, and are not tied to any single entity. These scripts can be found under Chaos.Scripts.FunctionalScripts . These scripts often use Formulae for calculations as part of their actions. Any functional scripts that utilize formulae should be implemented in a way that the formula used is swappable for other implementations of that formula. Let's use the DefaultApplyDamageScript functional script as an example. using Chaos.Common.Definitions; using Chaos.Formulae; using Chaos.Formulae.Abstractions; using Chaos.Objects.World; using Chaos.Objects.World.Abstractions; using Chaos.Scripting.Abstractions; using Chaos.Scripts.FunctionalScripts.Abstractions; namespace Chaos.Scripts.FunctionalScripts.ApplyDamage; public class DefaultApplyDamageScript : ScriptBase, IApplyDamageScript { public IDamageFormula DamageFormula { get; set; } public static string Key { get; } = GetScriptKey(typeof(DefaultApplyDamageScript)); public DefaultApplyDamageScript() => DamageFormula = DamageFormulae.Default; public virtual void ApplyDamage( Creature attacker, Creature defender, IScript source, int damage ) { damage = DamageFormula.Calculate( attacker, defender, source, damage); if (damage <= 0) return; switch (defender) { case Aisling aisling: aisling.StatSheet.SubtractHp(damage); aisling.Client.SendAttributes(StatUpdateType.Vitality); aisling.ShowHealth(); aisling.Script.OnAttacked(attacker, damage); if (!aisling.IsAlive) aisling.Script.OnDeath(attacker); break; case Monster monster: monster.StatSheet.SubtractHp(damage); monster.ShowHealth(); monster.Script.OnAttacked(attacker, damage); if (!monster.IsAlive) monster.Script.OnDeath(); break; case Merchant merchant: merchant.Script.OnAttacked(attacker, damage); break; } } public static IApplyDamageScript Create() => FunctionalScriptRegistry.Instance.Get<IApplyDamageScript>(Key); } In this class, you can see that this script is used to apply damage to a target, and uses the DefaultDamageFormula to calculate the damage before it applies it. The formula is stored by it's interface, making it swappable with other implementations of that interface. Anything that deals damage should do it through this script, rather than do it directly. This creates a single place where changes and logic can be made for how damage is applies. Functional Script Construction Functional scripts have a strange construction process. Because they generally deal with highly cross-cutting concerns, they should generally not be created through the IoC container. Instead, they should be created through a static factory method on the implementation. This static factory should reference the singleton instance of the FunctionalScriptRegistry . This class is responsible for creating functional scripts and injecting any dependencies they may have. Note The registry is configured at startup and automatically gathers type data for any implementations of IFunctionalScript .

articles/GeneralConfiguration.html.title: General Configuration | Chaos Server Docs
articles/GeneralConfiguration.html.keywords: General Configuration You can configure the Login and Lobby servers via appsettings.json file Here are a few quick tips, but there are more options available than are listed It's recommended to keep the staging data out of the repo, this base staging directory can be changed at Options:ChaosOptions:StagingDirectory Username/Password rules can be changed via Options:ActiveDirectoryCreentialManagerOptions If you want to spin up multiple worlds, or offer redirects to other people's worlds, you can add additional servers via Options:LobbyOptions:Servers If you want to accept redirects from other people, you need to communicate a reserved redirect id, and configure it via Options:LoginOptions:ReservedRedirects Edit your login notice message via Options:LoginOptions:NoticeMessage Edit your new character initial spawn point via Options:LoginOptions:StartingMapInstanceId and Options:LoginOptions:StartingPointStr If you want to change the folder structure of the server, each cache's directory can be changed via their Directory option Cache expiration can also be changed via ExpirationMins By default the server uses NLog for logging, but feel free to change it to whatever you want to use Log levels are also configurable via Options:Logging:LogLevel:Default and Options:Logging:NLog:rules:minLevel

articles/LobbyOptions.html.title: Lobby Options | Chaos Server Docs
articles/LobbyOptions.html.keywords: Lobby Options Lobby options are changed in appsettings.json via section "Options:LobbyOptions". This section is serialized into LobbyOptions Lobby-Server Settings Port The port the server will listen on. Default is 4200, if this value is changed, the client will need to be edited to connect to a different port. Servers When a client connects to a server, the first thing is displays to the player is a list of available login servers to connect to. When the original game first launched, there were 3 servers, and you would select the server you wanted to connect to at the lobby. For each of these servers, the name and a short description would display, and each would connect you to a unique world with it's own login server. Each server is serialized into ServerInfo ServerInfo Type Name Description int Id The id that will be used to redirect the client from the lobby server to the specified login server If the selected login server is also being hosted through this process, the object that manages redirects will recognize the id as being from an internal redirect source. If not, the redirect will be considered external, and will need this id placed in the LoginOptions as a reserved redirect string Name The name of the server as it will be displayed to players. Must be 9 or less characters long. string Hostname The dns entry to look up to find the ip address of the login server int Port The port the login server is hosted on string Description A short description of the login server. Must be 18 or less characters long. Examples The recommended way to use this configuration would be to set the port in your "appsettings.json", but leave the servers blank so they can be overridden depending on environment like so appsettings.json lobby options "LobbyOptions": { "Port": 4200, "Servers": [] } appsettings.local.json lobby options "LobbyOptions": { "Servers": [ { "Id": 0, "Name": "LocalTest", "HostName": "localhost", "Port": 4201, "Description": "Test server" } ] } appsettings.prod.json lobby options "LobbyOptions": { "Servers": [ { "Id": 0, "Name": "Chaos", "HostName": "chaos-server.net", "Port": 4201, "Description": "Private DA server" } ] }

articles/LoginOptions.html.title: Login Options | Chaos Server Docs
articles/LoginOptions.html.keywords: Login Options Login options are changed in appsettings.json via section Options:LoginOptions . This section is serialized into LoginOptions Login-Server Settings Port The port the server will listen on. Default is 4201, if this value is changed, the client will need to be edited to connect to a different port. WorldRedirect When a client logs into the game world the login server is for, that client is redirected to a World server. These are the details needed for that redirection Type Name Description string HostName The dns entry to look up to find the ip address of the world server int Port The port the world server is hosted on ReservedRedirects When a client is redirected from a lobby (server selection) to a login server, a redirect id is used to identify the client being redirected. If the client is unable to be identified, the connection is dropped. Because of this, if you want to accept redirects from external lobby servers, a redirect id will need to be communicated between them and yourself. This collection is used to store those reserved redirect ids. Type Name Description int Id The id that will be used to redirect the client from the lobby server to the specified login server string Name The name passed along with the redirect information, this should probably be the server name NoticeMessage This is the message that will be displayed to the player when they log in. This is a good place to put a message about the server being down for maintenance, or a message about the server being in beta. StartingMapInstanceId The instanceId of the map that the player will be placed in when they first create a character. StartingPointStr The coordinates of the point that the player will be placed at when they first create a character. Tip The format for this string has several options "StartingPointStr": "25 25" "StartingPointStr": "25, 25" "StartingPointStr": "(25, 25)" Examples appsettings.json login options "LoginOptions": { "HostName": "localhost", "Port": 4201, "WorldRedirect": { "HostName": "localhost", "Port": 4202 }, "StartingMapInstanceId": "Tutorial1", "StartingPointStr": "(5, 5)", "NoticeMessage": "under construction", "ReservedRedirects": [] } appsettings.prod.json lobby options "LoginOptions": { "HostName": "chaotic-minds.dynu.net", "Port": 6901, "WorldRedirect": { "HostName": "chaotic-minds.dynu.net", "Port": 6902 }, "StartingMapInstanceId": "Tutorial1", "StartingPointStr": "(5, 5)", "NoticeMessage": "This server is in beta\nPlease report any bugs to the discord", "ReservedRedirects": [ { "Id": 1, "Name": "Other Lobby" } ] }

articles/Scripts.html.title: Scripts | Chaos Server Docs
articles/Scripts.html.keywords: Scripts The server runs on scripts. Skills, Spells, Items, Dialogs, Monsters, Merchants, MapInstances, ReactorTiles, etc.. are all scripted objects. To control how these objects respond to input, a script must be written. Scripts can be found under Chaos.Scripts . There are a number of default scripts created as examples, but writing your own scripts is the only way to truly customize the server. There are 2 main types of scripts for most entities. Base Scripts and Configurable Scripts . Let's take item scripts as an example. There are 2 base types you can choose to use, the ItemScriptBase and the ConfigurableItemScriptBase . Base Scripts Base scripts are just empty scripts with no functionality. They have empty virtual implementations of all of the possible events that could occur for that object. These events are intended to be overridden and have functionality added. Tip Base scripts are intended for use when no external configuration is necessary. The script should generally do something specific Configurable Scripts Configurable scripts are also empty scripts with all empty virtual implementations. The difference here is that these scripts are intended to have variables passed into them from json. Configurable scripts have an underlying mechanism that populates protected read/writeable variables automatically if it can find that variable within the source json the entity was created from. Configurable scripts read from the scriptVars property from whatever entity is the subject of that script. For example, here is a script that is used for consumable items that give back health or mana. using Chaos.Common.Definitions; using Chaos.Objects.Panel; using Chaos.Objects.World; using Chaos.Scripts.ItemScripts.Abstractions; namespace Chaos.Scripts.ItemScripts; public class VitalityConsumableScript : ConfigurableItemScriptBase { /// <inheritdoc /> public VitalityConsumableScript(Item subject) : base(subject) { } /// <inheritdoc /> public override void OnUse(Aisling source) { if (HealthAmount.HasValue) source.UserStatSheet.AddHp(HealthAmount.Value); if (HealthPercent.HasValue) source.UserStatSheet.AddHealthPct(HealthPercent.Value); if (ManaAmount.HasValue) source.UserStatSheet.AddMp(ManaAmount.Value); if (ManaPercent.HasValue) source.UserStatSheet.AddManaPct(ManaPercent.Value); source.Client.SendAttributes(StatUpdateType.Vitality); source.Inventory.RemoveQuantity(Subject.Slot, 1); } #region ScriptVars protected int? HealthAmount { get; init; } protected int? HealthPercent { get; init; } protected int? ManaAmount { get; init; } protected int? ManaPercent { get; init; } #endregion } Note the scriptVars region. These properties don't appear to be set anywhere, but they are automatically populated by the script's base implementation from the item's json. Here is a json for an apple item, note the scriptVars property { "templateKey": "apple", "accountBound": false, "maxStacks": 100, "buyCost": 100, "sellValue": 50, "weight": 1, "name": "Apple", "panelSprite": 40, "scriptKeys": ["vitalityConsumable"], "scriptVars": { "vitalityConsumable": { "healthAmount": 100 } } } Here the scriptKeys collection contains the vitalityConsumable script key, signaling that the VitalityConsumableScript should be attached to this entity. The scriptVars object here provides configuration for that script. If multiple configurable scripts are used, multiple configurations can be specified. Note The key of a script is the name of the class without "Script" at the end. So VitalityConsumableScript would have the key VitalityConsumable "scriptKeys": { "vitalityConsumable": { ... }, "someQuest": { ... } }

articles/WorldOptions.html.title: World Options | Chaos Server Docs
articles/WorldOptions.html.keywords: World Options World options are changed in "appsettings.json" via section "Options:WorldOptions". This section is serialized into WorldOptions World-Server Settings Port The port the server will listen on. Default is 4202 LoginRedirect This is a redirect object that will be used to redirect players to the login server for this world when they log out. This object consists of a hostname and port. These values should usually match up to the hostname and port specified for the LoginOptions section. General Settings MaxGroupSize The maximum number of players that can be in a group together. If a group reaches this size, invites and invite accepts will fail. SaveIntervalMins This is the amount of time in minutes between global character saves. This is on top of players automatically saving when they log out. Warning Do not set this value too low or it will become a burden on the server. Tip A good range of values would be anywhere from 0.5 - 10 UpdatesPerSecond This is the number of times per second that the server will update the game state. .NET isn't great for this kind of workload due garbage collection and JIT recompilation/OSR. Caution I suggest a hard cap of 60 with a good default value of 30 Tip If desired you can set this to 3 to emulate the original game F1MerchantTemplateKey This is the template key of the merchant to display when a player presses F1. This is generally some kind of help npc Aisling Settings AislingAssailIntervalMs All creatures have an AssailInterval. AssailInterval is essentially the cooldown in milliseconds for skills marked as assails. This value is modified by the AtkSpeedPct attribute and can be modified to be 3x faster or slower than the base value. This property sets the base interval for all aislings. Tip A good starting value is 1500 DropRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they can drop items or gold on the ground. Note A value of -1 would effectively disable dropping items A value of 0 would only allow players to drop items directly beneath them A value of 13 would allow players to drop items anywhere in their viewport MaxHeldGold This is the maximum amount of gold a player can hold in their inventory. MaximumAislingAc This is the maximum amount of AC a player can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, higher AC = more damage taken. MaxLevel This is the level cap for players. Level formulas can be changed, but with the default level formula, if you reach this level you will stop gaining experience. MinimumAislingAc This is the minimum amount of AC a player can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, lower AC = less damage taken. Warning With the default damage formula, AC is a percentile, so -100 AC would make you invulnerable. PickupRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they pick up items or money from the ground. Note A value of -1 would effectively disable picking up items A value of 0 would only allow players to pick up items from directly beneath them A value of 13 would allow players to pick up items from anywhere in their viewport TradeRange This is the maximum distance from a player that they can initiate a trade with another player Note A value of -1 would effectively disable trading A value of 0 would only allow players to only trade with players on the same tile, which is generally impossible A value of 13 would allow players to trade with anyone in their viewport Monster Settings MaximumMonsterAc This is the maximum amount of AC a monster can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, higher AC = more damage taken. MinimumMonsterAc This is the minimum amount of AC a monster can have. damage formulas can be changed, but with the default damage formula, lower AC = less damage taken. Warning With the default damage formula, AC is a percentile, so -100 AC would make them invulnerable. Anti-Cheat Settings MaxActionsPerSecond It would be bad to allow players to perform an infinite number of actions per second. Anything without a cooldown could become a huge burden on the server. This value is used to control the maximum number of actions a player can take in a second. An action is defined as using any spell, skill, or item. This includes equipping items. Tip A good range of values for this would be 5 - 15 MaxSkillsPerSecond The maximum number of skills a player can use in a second. Assails do not count towards this value. This can be used to disallow combos. Tip Use a low value like 3 if you want to disallow combos, otherwise use a higher value like 30 MaxSpellsPerSecond The maximum number of spells a player can cast in a second. Note This can be used to somewhat emulate the original game with a setting of 3, but keep in mind this server responds immediately, not in a 3updates per 1 second loop MaxChantTimeBurdenMs When players cast spells, each spell line takes approximately 1000ms to chant. The amount of time a spell will take to cast can be predicted to be 1000ms * (NumSpellLines). Due to latency and jitter, players will often cast spells for slightly more or less than the expected amount of time. With big latency spikes, the observed amount of time could be far off than the expected value. To be able to tolerate this while also prohibiting "speed casting", the server will allow spell casts that occur too quickly and add up a time burden. Each time a player casts a spell that completes faster than expected, the difference in time will be added to the time burden. This burden will accumulate with every consecutive spell that occurs too quickly, and be subtracted from if a spell completes too slowly. The time burden will also decrease while not casting spells. If the time burden exceeds MaxChantTimeBurdenMs, the spell cast will be ignored. Tip A good range of values for this setting would be 500 - 1500, with lower values being more strict. ProhibitF5Walk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing refreshing(F5) to walk faster. ProhibitItemSwitchWalk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing item switching to walk faster. ProhibitSpeedWalk When this is enabled it will prevent players from utilizing more nefarious methods to walk faster. RefreshIntervalMs This is the quickest interval in milliseconds that players will be allowed to refresh their client. This will not include refreshes utilized by the server, such as for refreshing a player's position if they walk into a wall. Tip A good value here would be 1000 Example WorldOptions "WorldOptions": { "Port": 4202, "LoginRedirect": { "HostName": "localhost", "Port": 4201 }, "RefreshIntervalMs": 1000, "TradeRange": 4, "DropRange": 4, "PickupRange": 4, "UpdatesPerSecond": 30, "SaveIntervalMins": 5, "MaxGroupSize": 6, "MaxGoldHeld": 500000000, "MinimumMonsterAc": -99, "MaximumMonsterAc": 100, "MinimumAislingAc": -90, "MaximumAislingAc": 100, "MaxLevel": 99, "MaxActionsPerSecond": 10, "MaxSkillsPerSecond": 5, "MaxSpellsPerSecond": 3, "AislingAssailIntervalMs": 1500, "ProhibitF5Walk": true, "ProhibitItemSwitchWalk": true, "ProhibitSpeedWalk": true, "MaxChantTimeBurdenMs": 1500, "F1MerchantTemplateKey": "Help" }

index.html.keywords: This is the HOMEPAGE . Refer to Markdown for how to write markdown files. Quick Start Notes: Add images to the images folder if the file is referencing an image.
